title.rendered: FInd Rooms For Rent In Rochester, NY

content.rendered:
Do you find Rochester’s avid music scene, affordable rent, & friendly atmosphere calling your name? We’ve compiled everything you need to know about finding rooms for rent in Rochester, NY.

Getting to Know Rochester, NY

Filled with rich culture, love for music and increasing job opportunities, more people are moving to this city in hopes of a better quality of life. If you love the snow, you’re in luck as the city sees heavy snow coverage during the colder months. Apart from the lively people of the city, the mouthwatering food is also drawing people in. One thing’s for sure, there won’t be a day when you’re bored in this city.

Related: Is It Time for You to Move to Another City?

Finding Rooms for Rent in Rochester, NY

Compared to the cost of rooms for rent in NYC, Rochester is much cheaper. While a roommate may be a necessity for renting a room in NYC, in Rochester, NY, you can afford to live alone in studio apartments. Some neighborhoods have cheaper rents, but most areas of the city are affordable.

Find Rooms for Rent in Rochester

Top Neighborhoods in Rochester, NY

  • Park Avenue: One of the most walkable neighborhoods in the city, it is filled with shops and quaint cafes to spend your evenings in. A suburban neighborhood where you can spend your weekdays sitting on the porch and enjoying a warm beverage.
  • Grove Place: Though located in the heart of the city, this quaint neighborhood has survived the clutches of modernization. Surrounded by modern buildings and busy highways, the historic architecture provides a breath of fresh air.
  • Neighborhood of the Arts: A neighborhood is not just about a cluster of buildings, but about the community and culture as well. Ideal for those who want to express their creative talent, this neighborhood also features the iconic Memorial Art Gallery tower.

Related: What Happens When You Share an Apartment with Too Many Roommates?

3. Average Rent in Rochester, NY

5. University Life in Rochester, NY

Typical of any university in any city, your student life in Rochester will be filled with club activities, classes and meeting new people. Be warned, Rochester experiences pretty heavy snowfalls, so don’t pack light for the colder months of the year. Here, you have the opportunity of discovering smaller cafes living relatively far from the hustle and bustle of a busy city life, while also enjoying music, arts and other entertainment activities. When living with roommates in Rochester, NY, you will have plenty places to explore.

  • University of Rochester
  • Rochester Institute of Technology
  • John Fisher College
  • Nazareth College
  • Roberts Wesleyan College

Related: What You Should Know About Living with Roommates in College

6. How Transit Friendly is Rochester, NY?

Don’t have a car? No problem! There are plenty of ways to get around the city, including walking to your destination.

1. Walkability in Rochester, NY

Rochester is a highly walkable city. If you’re planning on renting a room in Rochester, NY, then you will be happy to know that most errands can be accomplished on foot. You do not have to rely on public transport or a car, as the city has plenty of skyways and walkways for pedestrians to get around safely. Some neighborhoods are more walkable than others, but overall, you will have no problem trusting your two feet when you’re in the city.

2. Roads/traffic in Rochester, NY

Apart from winter when the city experiences heavy snowfall, the roads are never too bad. Traffic does not get too heavy, and you can expect to reach your destination relatively quickly. There’s no need to account for a heavy traffic, the roads are easy to navigate, and make getting around the city a great experience.

3. Taxis in Rochester, NY

Taxi service, car rentals, Uber and Lyft are easily available within the city. Some areas may be more accessible via a car, and residents can opt for any of these services for a smooth travel experience.

4. Public Transportation in Rochester, NY

The Regional Transit Service provides public transportation services for the city. Extensive bus routes are present throughout the city, and the buses come with bike racks as well, making them more accessible to residents. If you want to go outside of town, you can easily opt for Amtrak.

5. Airports in Rochester, NY

The Greater Rochester Airport services the city, and it is fairly affordable. With numerous airlines providing flight via this airport, it is a convenient way to travel outside of the city. Recent renovations have enhanced the functionality of the airport and made it more eco-friendly with the inclusion of solar panels and rainwater collection systems.

Related: A New York Travel Guide for Long Vacations

6. Cycling in Rochester, NY

According to the League of American Bicyclists, Rochester is a Bicycle Friendly Community. With several miles of bicycle infrastructure already in place, the city plans on expanding bike trails, provides street markings and more bike lanes. There are plans to create a separate cycle lane, which will be fully separated pathways for bikes.

Restaurants in Rochester, NY

Rochester is no less than a haven for foodies. With interesting flavor to explore around the city, it is no wonder that many refer to it as THE foodie city. The city gets breakfast sandwiches right, with most outlets offering you a delicious bite to start your day on a good note. That’s not all though. There is a lot to explore in the city, such as its signature Garbage Plate dish.

  • Lento Restaurant
  • The Revelry
  • The Owl House

Cultural Activities in Rochester, NY

Rochester is no stranger when it comes to cultural activities such as music arts and theatre. From high-profile live music events, to grassroots production by young artists, the city has it all. If you appreciate original theatrical performances, don’t forget to check out the theatre scene in Rochester. With major festivals taking place throughout the year, you will have a lot to explore.

  • Rochester Music Hall of Fame
  • Rochester International Jazz Festival
  • The Rochester Civic Theatre Company
